to fight/fight/war/battle
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do

definition: to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do

definition: to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4 , zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4

sentences.english: Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache.
sentences.chinese: 因此，爱情战无不胜，只战不胜贫穷与牙痛。

sentences.english: Because of a friend's help and encouragement, you will be invincible and indomitable.
sentences.chinese: 因为朋友的相助和激励，你才会战无不胜，一往无前。

sentences.english: Before his heart attack, he said, “I thought I was invincible.
sentences.chinese: 他说“做心脏手术之前，我觉得我战无不胜。”

sentences.english: Let us disabuse ourselves of the idea that we are invincible.
sentences.chinese: 让我们打消我们是战无不胜的错误念头。

sentences.english: Your companions have become victorious, what are you waiting for now?
sentences.chinese: 你的同伴已成为战无不胜的，你还在等什么，现在？

definition: to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4 , zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4

definition: to be invincible/unrivalled
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
to inspire awe throughout the empire (idiom)
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
to be successful in every endeavor
to inspire awe
to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
bold and powerful/brave and fierce
command/commander-in-chief
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
fame for fighting prowess/military glory
lit. strong soldiers and sturdy horses (idiom)/fig. a well-trained and powerful army
brilliant/impressive/outstanding
fighting and winning a series of battles (idiom); ever victorious
